VLIB_disparity_SAD_firstRow16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_disparity_SAD_firstRow16 (const uint16_t *restrict pLeft, const uint16_t *restrict pRight, uint32_t *restrict pCost, uint32_t *restrict pMinCost, uint32_t *restrict pScratch, int8_t *restrict pDisparity, int32_t displacement, int32_t width, int32_t pitch, int32_t windowSize)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_disparity_SAD_firstRow16 ( const uint16_t *restrict  pLeft,
const uint16_t *restrict  pRight,
uint32_t *restrict  pCost,
uint32_t *restrict  pMinCost,
uint32_t *restrict  pScratch,
int8_t *restrict  pDisparity,
int32_t  displacement,
int32_t  width,
int32_t  pitch,
int32_t  windowSize 
)

Description
This function calculates the disparity at each position in the first row of an 16-bit stereo image pair. Subsequent rows should use the VLIB_disparity_SAD16 function.
Parameters:
[in] *pLeft Pointer to left image (UQ15.0)
[in] *pRight Pointer to right image (UQ15.0)
[in,out] *pCost Cost corresponding to current displacement (UQ32.0)
[in,out] *pMinCost Minimum cost across all displacements (UQ32.0)
[in,out] *pScratch Scratch Memory (UQ32.0)
[in,out] *pDisparity Displacement having the minimum cost (SQ8.0)
[in] displacement Current displacement (in pixels)
[in] width Output width of disparity row (in pixels)
[in] pitch Pitch of the input images (in pixels)
[in] windowSize Size of the block used for computing SAD (in pixels) (eg. a value of 5 represents a 5x5 window block size)
Assumptions
  • This function should only be called to compute the first row disparities (adjusted by windowSize) of an image. Subsequent rows should be computed by calling the VLIB_disparity_SAD16 function in order from top to bottom of the image.
  • This function should be called multiple times for the first row of the image: once for each displacement to search. Each time, the pRight pointer and displacement variable should be modified to search for disparities at each displacement required. Each invocation of the function updatest the pCost, pMinCost, and pDisparity buffers.
  • Before calling this function the first time, the following buffers should be set accordingly:
    • pMinCost should be filled with 0x7FFFFFFF's (max value of a signed 32 bit variable).
    • pDisparity should be filled with 0's.
  • The pCost buffer should never be altered in between subsequent calls to this function throughout the entire frame. It is used to store inter-row state information.
  • windowSize should be an odd value.
  • pitch should be >= (width + (number of disparities to search - 1) + (windowSize - 1)). This is required in order to ensure that disparities are not calculated based on wrap-around from other lines in the input images.
  • The following list minimum buffer requirements: pMinCost = width elements rounded up to the nearest multiple of 4 plus 1 pCost = width elements rounded up to the nearest multiple of 4 plus 1, times the number of disparities to search. pDisparity = width elements rounded up to the nearest multiple of 4 plus 1, times the number of lines to output pScratch = width elements + windowSize rounded up to the nearest multiple of 4
  • The pointer values for pLeft and pRight should account for the windowSize. For example, if windowSize=5, then the pointer values should be adjusted at least windowSize/2 (5/2=2) pixels from the left border, and windowSize/2 (5/2=2) lines from the top or bottom of the image ... otherwise, the algorithm would access out of bound memory.
  • Due to an optimization using the _sub2() instruction, which works on signed 16 bit inputs, the most significant bit of the input (bit 15) should be 0. This means the effective dynamic range of the input data is 15 bits, not 16. If a full 16 bits is required, please contact TI to make us aware of the priority this use case.
  • The pScratch buffer should be 8-byte aligned.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
